metadata.title: CVE-2019-5815 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Type confusion in xsltNumberFormatGetMultipleLevel prior to libxslt 1.1.33could allow attackers to potentially exploit heap corruption via craftedXML data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libxslt1.1 - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.3+esm1
python-libxslt1 - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.3+esm1
xsltproc - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
libxslt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.3+esm1').
